result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G. Phelps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs and surcharges.
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*AODA Assessment and any other recommendations agent requires

*Complete the domestic abuse education programming.
*Random urine analysis if agent requires.

Count 1:  Imposed but STAYED Jail and Placed on Probation
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In

9:04 AM Defendant Michael G. Phelps in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Michael G. Phelps.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-3 and 22CF-389.

Court calls cases.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
22CF-3 - State just filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 would be dismissed and read in.
Defendant will plead to 22CF-389 , Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defense has a copy of the amended information for 22CF-3.

State will also file an information in 22CF-389.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF-3: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-389: Count 1: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 in 22CF-3 and Count 1 in 22CF-389.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
22CF-3: Count 1: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-389: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF-3:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 6 months.
Huber granted.
1 day credit.
Imposed and Stayed.
Probation for a period of 1 year.
Conditions:
Complete the domestic abuse education programming.
AODA Assessment and any other recommendations agent requires.
Random urine analysis if agent requires.
Pay costs and surcharges. 

22CF-389:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 60 days.
Huber granted.
2 days credit.
Consecutive to 22CF-3.
Imposed and Stayed.
Probation for a period of 2 years.
Conditions:
Complete the domestic abuse education programming.
AODA Assessment and any other recommendations agent requires.
Random urine analysis if agent requires.
Pay costs and surcharges.
